Dear Ms. Thorpe:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 22, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a
written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved; this includes identifying
behaviorally specific action steps.
o Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Individuals directly responsible for implementing the corrective action step for
each licensing statute and rule, Contract item, DHHS policy or MISEP section
citation; e.g. workers, supervisors, program managers, director, etc.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
implemented and completed.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved; this
includes identifying specific action steps for continuous monitoring.
 Signature of the responsible party and date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
(5) Floors, interior walls, and ceilings shall be sound and in
good repair and shall be maintained in a clean condition.
The basement in the facility is the location of the washer and dryer and the youth are
required to use this space to do their own laundry. The basement has the smell of
mildew and in need of general clean up and repair. The walls show signs of water
damage and need to be cleaned and repainted as does the floor.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 A discussion of the condition of the basement was had and it was explained
that since this is an area that the youth use it needs to meet the same
standards as the other areas used. It was also discussed the process of the
youth’s laundry and the facility reported that staff will engage in doing the
youth’s laundry and will also use a local laundromat until such time that the
basement is brought up to standard.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
1

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this licensing
period.
The facility provided copies of all the incident reports (nine) occurring during this
reporting period. These incidents involved, youth on youth aggression, AWOL,
stealing, and destruction of property. These incident reports were reviewed, and it
appears that the facility was attentive and provided the appropriate actions to ensure
the youth’s safety and security.
Interviews involved all youth, direct care staff, supervisors, and administration. The
youth all report feeling safe at the facility and having their individual needs addressed.
They report weekly individual therapy and staff’s interactions with them as something
positive. Staff report a strong desire to provide best practice for the youth and having
administration support these efforts to provide for the youth.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on
their regular license.
